definition: (politics) strongman/(in the workplace, esp. of a woman) a highly capable person/(old) robber
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to force someone to do something

sentences.english: Military strongmen have ruled Egypt since 1952.
sentences.chinese: 从1952年起，军事强人就统治埃及。

sentences.english: Over all, Egypt’s competitiveness is mediocre but not terrible.
sentences.chinese: 总体来说，埃及的竞争力差强人意，但也不算太糟。

sentences.english: That dragon lady have three gigolo under her husbands nose.
sentences.chinese: 那位女强人当着丈夫的面，公开有三位小白脸。

sentences.english: The Moneyless Man knows how to party for free
sentences.chinese: 下文这位不名一文的强人教你如何免费开派对。

sentences.english: If your wife is a superwoman, will you have any pressure?
sentences.chinese: 如果家里有个女强人老婆，你会不会有压力呢？

sentences.english: The two men have signed treaties of friendship and cooperation on various levels.
sentences.chinese: 这两位政治强人曾数次签署不同层次的互助合作条约。

sentences.english: Unlike on previous occasions, he made no attempt to appear as Russia's strongman.
sentences.chinese: 与以前不一样的是，他没有试图显得像个俄罗斯强人。

sentences.english: But speaking as a friend of House, he seems to be attracted to strong women.
sentences.chinese: 作为豪斯的朋友我敢说他更容易被女强人吸引。

sentences.english: All staff of Hongqiang company look forward to sincere cooperation with you and will provide you with the best services.
sentences.chinese: 爱信宏强人愿与您真诚合作，为您提供最满意的服务。
他们的表演尚差强人意。

sentences.english: The past month has seen a flurry of female firsts in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的一个月中，日本突然涌现出了一批女强人。

sentences.english: But this is obviously an outrageous demand given China's stable development strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这在中国追求稳定发展之际无疑是强人所难，此其一。

sentences.english: Thus we become greedy, stingy, and inconsiderate.
sentences.chinese: 于是，我们变得贪婪，吝啬，和强人所难。

sentences.english: He knew what he wanted to say, but the actual articulation was difficult for him.
sentences.chinese: 英语准确的音节对于他来说是有些强人所难。

sentences.english: Are you a passable guitar player?
sentences.chinese: 你是个差强人意的吉他手吗？

sentences.english: Many of Ozawa's ideas have been overshadowed by his poor image.
sentences.chinese: 许多小泽的构想因为他差强人意的形象而失去了光彩。

definition: opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
an eccentric/odd person/person of extraordinary talent
correct/normal/to be on good terms with/on the right track/right
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
(in the negative) (not) to be trifled with
